hint: Focus on pushing filters earlier in the query plan, converting implicit joins to explicit JOIN syntax, and isolating selective date_dim filters into CTEs to reduce join cardinality early.
Restructure using CTEs to pre-filter all dimension tables (customer, address, date, item) and potentially fact tables, then join explicitly. This isolates filter-heavy operations.
Materialize multiple pre-filtered CTEs (dimensions and fact subsets), then decompose the OR condition by evaluating store_sales and web_sales/catalog_sales paths separately before combining.

Transform the OR of two EXISTS subqueries into a UNION ALL of two main queries (one per channel), then aggregate the unioned results. Also explore converting implicit joins to explicit star-join patterns.
